item.title: wong-kar-wai
item.description: The lasting legacy of Wong Kar-wai Amidst the trend of action and Kung Fu films, director Wong Kar-wai cultivated several garden patches of colourful orchids Mukund Setlur, [A still from ‘In the mood for love’] The Hong Kong film industry was called the Hollywood of the East. Film historians talk about the glorious 1980s to the early 2000s when the Hong Kong film industry produced several international hits. These films were largely action thrillers or Kung Fu films that caught the fascination of the western world.
